Currently Query instance has no extentMap set here and evaluation causes:

java.lang.NullPointerException
	at org.eclipse.emf.ocl.expressions.impl.EvaluationVisitorImpl.visitOperationCallExp(EvaluationVisitorImpl.java:1129)
	at org.eclipse.emf.ocl.expressions.impl.OperationCallExpImpl.accept(OperationCallExpImpl.java:274)
	at org.eclipse.emf.ocl.query.impl.QueryImpl.evaluate(QueryImpl.java:236)
One easy way to resolve this problem might be to use the IOCLHelper API
instead of Query.  The OCL helper implementation uses a LazyExtentMap that
computes the extent of an EClass on the fly by searching for instances
within the context element's resource.

Perhaps there are reasons that I don't know about, why IOCLHelper isn't a
good fit for this situation.
In case that allInstances() operation is used in query ocl expression, extentMap is created and assigned to Query instance before evaluation and destroyed after.
